page.title: 14Houses in Stanton-u-Bardon
page.content: Mr.Tonge, Manager of Council Properties, Hinckley and Bosworth Borough Council wrote to us about the {Airey houses}in Stanton under Bardon. He said that they were built shorty after the war,as{system-built {dwellings}recommened by the then Ministry of Housing.This type of construction of a dwelling was a quick,easy and a cheap way of providing{good housing accommodation for a lot of people, and were expected to last for{thirty years. The properties were constructed in factories and then brought to the site as a package for easy erection on a prepared base.They are being knocked down because the{concrete panels, which have metal reinforcing rods in the centre,have{aged}and the structure weak.It was{more economic to demolish them and to rebuild new properties.
